alert.note: Alert for Greater Oconee; Oconee Mountains (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 9:12PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Franklin, Stephens, Habersham, Rabun, western Hart and southwestern Oconee Counties through 945 PM EDT... At 912 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 11 miles north of Cleveland to 9 miles south of Clarkesville to 5 miles east of Commerce. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Toccoa, Clayton, Clarkesville, Carnesville, Cornelia, Baldwin, Royston, Lavonia, Gumlog and Demorest. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
